data.title: Get Help With Your Application
data.meta_description: Get assistance with general inquiries, and your Discrimination Financial Assistance Program (DFAP) Application, including how to get in-person assistance through a local office.
data.text:
There are many ways to get help with your application, described below:

For no-cost assistance in a language other than English, please call 1-800-721-0970 or email [email protected]

Number to Call for Additional Help

The DFAP Call Center will assist you with general inquiries and answer questions you may have in completing your application. You can reach them by email at [email protected] or phone at 1-800-721-0970.

DFAP Call Center is open from 8 am EST to 8 pm PST, 7 days per week, excluding federal holidays. On Wednesday, Jan. 17, the DFAP Call Center will be open from 8 a.m, EST to midnight PST.

Make an Appointment

If you would like to schedule time at a DFAP local office, please call the DFAP Call Center at 1-800-721-0970. After selecting your preferred language, press Option 3. This will connect you with a team member who will help you with setting an appointmentâin person at a local office, on the phone, or virtually - that fits your schedule.

You can schedule an appointment for the following:

Get help with your application

Get help scanning your supporting documentation

Get other help

Help on the Phone or Online

Help by online video call:

English. We offer two online group sessions to assist you with the application process every Tuesday, Thursday, and Sunday:

Program Overview Sessions from 4-5 p.m. Eastern Time

10-Step Application Process (an in-depth look at each section of the application): 6-8 p.m. Eastern

To access these meetings in English, follow this link: Program Sessions in English

Spanish. We offer one online group session to assist you with the application process every Tuesday and Thursday:

10-Step Application Process (an in-depth look at each section of the application): 2-4 p.m. Pacific

To access these meetings in Spanish, follow this link: Program Sessions in Spanish

Or you can contact the Call Center to schedule a virtual appointment for individual technical assistance. Email [email protected] or call 1-800-721-0970.

Local Offices

Team members can assist you with the following services:

Completing and filing your application through eFile or on a paper copy

Checking the status of your application

Assisting you with scanning images of your documentation

Providing interpretation and translation services

Access to computers for filling out and filing your application

Please remember; filing an application is free, you are not required to have an attorney assist you in order to apply, and DFAP team members can provide no-cost help. If you choose to come into a local office, parking is always free. When you arrive, look for the Discrimination Financial Assistance Program (DFAP) signage. See below for local offices.

Please Note: All applications must be submitted by January 17, 2024. Local offices will be closed January 15, in observance of the Martin Luther King, Jr. Federal Holiday. All local offices will be open January 16 & 17, 2024. All local offices will be closed starting January 18, 2024.

Local Events

Local events are being organized to provide help to people who are not near a local office. At these local events, we can assist you with:

Completing and filing your application through eFile or on a paper copy

Checking the status of your application

Providing interpretation and translation services

When you arrive, please look for the DFAP signage. If there are no events listed in your state, please check back as our local events schedule will be updated. Stay tuned!

If you have specific questions related to the events, please contact 1-800-721-0970 for more information.

State

Community Groups

To support producers throughout the application process, USDA is partnering with organizations with extensive experience conducting outreach to farm organizations. These organizations are well equipped to share information about the Program and provide assistance with applications. (They are not involved in the programâs design, administration, or vendor-selection.)

The groups include:

AgrAbility

Farmer Veteran Coalition

Farmersâ Legal Action Group

Federation of Southern Cooperatives

Intertribal Agriculture Council

Land Loss Prevention Project

National Young Farmers Coalition

Rural Coalition working with its member organizations, including:

Grupo Amor de Homestead

Latino Farmers of the Southeast
